intro: Polygonum telonense, commonly known as the red root or redstem filaree, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It is characterized by its upright, branching stems that are often reddish in color, especially when mature. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Polygonum telonense is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade environments.
